headline.main: ANKARA REACHES CHROMIUM ACCORD; Agrees to Sell Germany Metal After Terminatirfn of Pact With Britain in 1943 TO GET ARMS IN RETURN Turks Contract to Supply Ore Only to the Value of Goods Nazis Actually Deliver

lead_paragraph: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 7 -- The Turkish Government agreed today to deliver chromium to Germany in 1943, after the expiration of the present agreement with Great Britain. In exchange, Germany will immediately deliver war materials to Turkey.
abstract: Clodius threatens conf end; Turkey agrees to 1943-44 chromium shipments in exch for immediate war goods shipments; Brit and U S Ambs informed

keywords.name: glocations
keywords.value: MEDITERRANEAN, AFRICAN, BALKAN AND NEAR EAST AREAS

snippet: ANKARA, Turkey, Oct. 7 -- The Turkish Government agreed today to deliver chromium to Germany in 1943, after the expiration of the present agreement with Great Britain. In exchange, Germany will immediately deliver war materials to Turkey....

byline.original: By RAY BROCKSpecial Broadcast to THE NEW YORK TIMES
